Derek James wrote:

>I don't know how *nice* he is, but maybe you're right.
> At least there are some references for his
>credentials.  He does use very broad, grandiose
>rhetoric regarding neural networks (e.g., he calls
>neural networks "brains", "The brains will be trained
>to solve a famous engineering problem: balancing an
>inverted pendulum.").  I suppose he does so in order
>to try to impress prospective investors.
>
>Fair enough.  
>  
>
Yeh I know marketing spin sends all the wrong signals to technically 
minded people. It really is all BS but it's just one of those necessary 
evils I guess. They key is to cut through the blurb and get to the facts.

Colin
